About

Daniel Gologorsky, MD, MBA is a compassionate Ophthalmologist and fellowship-trained Retina specialist who takes care of patients with diabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, retinal vascular occlusions, as well as other general eye pathology including glaucoma and dry eye. He sees patients in Miami-Dade, Broward, and Palm Beach.

A prolific reader and lecturer, Dr. Gologorsky has revived his residency blog (EyeBlog) to share his passion for ophthalmology and help his patients learn about the eye and eye disease.

This website does not replace the need to visit an eye doctor and receive professional medical advice. Please get in touch with any questions or blog post topic suggestions.

Education & Training

Fellowship in diseases of the Retina and Vitreous.

Ophthalmology residency. The US News & World Report ranks Bascom Palmer Eye Institute as the #1 Ophthalmology hospital and research center for the 16th consecutive year.

Multiple awards for clinical excellence and medical research.

Tuck placed #2 in the 2019-2020 Bloomberg Businessweek ranking of full-time MBA programs.

Chemistry & Chemical Biology major. Graduated magna cum laude, Phi Beta Kappa, 4.0 GPA.

EyeBlog: Common eye conditions explained.

Consulting

Dr. Gologorsky has extensive background in consulting for both public entities and private companies. His specialities include retina, ophthalmology, operations management, emergency eye care, and maritime healthcare. In addition, he is available for medical-legal consultations. Please get in touch with any questions.
